attributes.action: Halt the gross overdevelopment of Brighton Marina and beyond.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Planning Application BH2008/02816
The proposed development is on a nationally protected Site of Special Scientific Interest and is outside any planning policy development boundary, recent guidance and advice notes refer to opportunities within the marina not beyond it.
It states in the correspondence that “the structure will establish a development             site” – if approved, setting a precedent for more building beyond the marina boundary, eroding the natural beauty of the local environment.  
The application is not “conceived in accordance with the principles of sustainable development” to quote from the application correspondence. It will destroy part of an SSSI; it is in the coastal floodplain; it would be built in the new National Park; the demands of hundreds of people on an inadequate infrastructure have not been addressed. 
It takes development beyond the settlement boundary into the natural environment.
